body:
This is slightly related to https://github.com/fastify/fastify/issues/538, but a different use case.

I propose that:

```js
fastify.get('/', (req, reply) => {
  reply.send('hello world')
})
```

Renders `hello world` instead of `"hello world"`.

issue.title: Fix 540

repository.description: Fast and low overhead web framework, for Node.js

body:
Why?

This can be achieved with
```
fastify.get('/', (req, reply) => {
  reply.type('text/plain').send('hello world')
})
```
Because that's not what user will expect.

issue.title: Strings should not be wrapped in quotes

repository.name: fastify
repository.description: Fast and low overhead web framework, for Node.js

issue.body:
Hi,

First of all i love the simplicity and clean approch with the framework.

However, i am woriking with at SqlServer that returns json as a string.

I would like to output the  string while keeping the content-type as json.

As far as i know fastify automaticly wraps the content ind quotes if reply.send is passed a string.

How would one achive this :-) ?

My current workarround is the following.

`
reply.header("Content-Type", "application/json").serializer(i => i).send(result.recordsets[0][0]["JSON_F52E2B61-18A1-11d1-B105-00805F49916B"]);
`

issue.title: Reply Header Example in Docs: Response without Double Quoted

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Help the community by contributing to this issue

repository.name: fastify
repository.description: Fast and low overhead web framework, for Node.js

issue.body:
Hi,
Maybe this example in the docs will help other noobs like me. :)

There is a note in [Reply Header](http://www.fastify.io/docs/v0.27.x/Reply/#header) documentation:
_Note that if you are using a custom serializer that does not serialize to JSON, you must set a custom 'Content-Type' header._

It is better if the documentation include an additional example to that note.
For example this simple code:

`reply.send('OK');`
will output 

> "OK"

Double quoted because by default fastify will do JSON serialization, while
`reply.header('Content-Type', 'text/html').send('OK');`
or using shortcut
`reply.type('text/html').send('OK');`
will output

> OK

without the double quote.

Hope this helps.
Thanks.

issue.title: Skip serialization for json string

labels.name: bugfix
labels.description: Issue or PR that should land as semver patch
